author: john_89
content: I did not read it from official docs. But on some blog.

author: john_89
content: I have another question: What will happen to the web3.js when you change the consensus under the hood?

author: ja_0001
content: Hi mate. Please correct it if I am mistaken the consensus incoming era: Everything beside becoming deflationary, ultra scalable and greener ! Will stay the same or at least would improve!

author: sky.cactus
content: From an end-user perspective, there should be no visible change other than block production will become more reliable.  There are some significant security benefits from the shift as well, and a reduction in cost of security, but those won't be directly visible to users.

author: ja_0001
content: Thanks for sharing. Agreed. Thats what really matters satisfied customers in a reliable block production consensus.
